channel.title: VPS Guide
channel.description:
[center][b]What is a VPS?[/b][/center] [center]A virtual private server (VPS, also referred to as Virtual Dedicated Server or VDS) is a method of splitting a server. Each virtual server can run its own full-fledged operating system, and each server can be independently rebooted.[/center]
[center][b]Suggested places to buy a VPS.[/b][/center] [center][url=http://www.vpsland.com]http://www.vpsland.com[/url] [url=http://x10vps.com/]http://x10vps.com/[/url] [url=http://www.swvps.com/]http://www.swvps.com/[/url] After you buy a VPS and the payment goes through it will take anywhere from 24-76 hours for you to recieve the VPS information.[/center]
[center][b]Connecting to your VPS.[/b][/center] [center]First you must wait for an email with VPS information from wherever you bought the vps, it should look something like this: [img]http://i38.tinypic.com/i3hsg9.png[/img] Next go to Start > Run > MSTSC. It will load something that looks like this: [img]http://i36.tinypic.com/rvai3c.png[/img] Enter in the IP address they sent you in the "computer" space, then in the "user name" enter [code]administrator[/code]. Then it will load up a program and you should see this: [img]http://img834.imageshack.us/img834/5231/loginlz.png[/img] Type in your Root Password you set up during buying the VPS.[/center]
[center][b]Running your server on your VPS[/b][/center] [center]Now you are on your VPS, next you need to download JDK before you can even run your server. So to download it go to: [url=http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html]http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html[/url] Next you need to set your environment variables: We will go to "My Computer" and click "View System Information". As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says "Advanced" and at the bottom, click "Environmental Variables". For you Classpath variable replace it with this: [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code] Next find your Path variable and replace with this: [code]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin;[/code] If you are not running a 64-Bit System delete the [code] (x86)[/code] from the Classpath and Path variables. If a new version of JDK is released just edit the variables to fit yours, you also [u]do not[/u] have to port-forward on a VPS. [/center]
[center][b]Getting your server files.[/b][/center] [center]You will need to be able to get your server files over to your VPS, most of you should be able to figure this out on your own but for those who can't I will tell you how. Use a file sharing site, there are many out there that are free but I will put a list of ones I most commonly use: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/]http://www.mediafire.com/[/url] [url=http://www.megaupload.com/]http://www.megaupload.com/[/url] [url=http://uppit.com/]http://uppit.com/[/url] [url=http://www.fileden.com/]http://www.fileden.com/[/url] You will also need to download Winrar to extract them which can be found here: [url=http://www.rarlab.com/]http://www.rarlab.com/[/url][/center]
[center][b]Last few things.[/b][/center] [center]If you try to run a Auto-Restarter or .exe on your VPS you might possibly get this error: [img]http://img339.imageshack.us/img339/3805/applicationfailedtoload.png[/img] Don't worry, it is easy to fix. First go to this site:[url=http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=333325fd-ae52-4e35-b531-508d977d32a6&displaylang=en]Click Me![/url] Then you will see this: [img]http://img51.imageshack.us/img51/1313/net35.png[/img] Download it, it is "Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5" and it will allow you to run .exe files.[/center]
[center][b]Credits[/b][/center] [center][b]12igon8:[/b]For the tutorial he made which originally helped me months ago and made me want to improve upon it. [b]The Soul:[/b]For his tutorial on starting a server which helped me a while ago and also came in handy for Environment Variables. [quote="Taharok, post:1, topic:265742"]You may post a tutorial that has already been created [i]if and only if[/i] it surpasses any existing tutorials of its type.[/quote][/center]

item.description:
@itai wrote:

[quote=“i do skill, post:11, topic:353650”]I Bought A VPS FRom VPSland.com well i got an e mail directly after the payment shell i wait 24h while they send me the IP ? so i can upload files and connect to The VPS ? all e mails i got is some informations like Paymant No.
Account ID.
And others…
I need help with the Remote Desktop Connection Because I Have everything Empty idk wut to fill them
PLEASE Replay Thank you

MSN: blackouttwo@hotmail.com[/quote]
You have to wait until you get the IP to upload, or until you can download your server files onto your VPS. Please be more specific on what you cannot fill out on Remote Desktop Connection.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Guide
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

im the one who made i guess the “big” VPS guide…and this guy posted on it like 5 times about how good it was…idk something smells leech?

Well that was months ago and if you read my credits then you would realize I didn’t leach, I improved upon yours and since you couldn’t help me with some of the problems I had I fixed then decided to post this a couple months after solving them. Oh yeah I posted that it was good I believe once, the other times was trying to get help. But like I said above I fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Guide
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

[center]What is a VPS?[/center]
[center]A virtual private server (VPS, also referred to as Virtual Dedicated Server or VDS) is a method of splitting a server. Each virtual server can run its own full-fledged operating system, and each server can be independently rebooted.[/center]

[center]Suggested places to buy a VPS.[/center]
[center]http://www.vpsland.com
http://x10vps.com/
http://www.swvps.com/
After you buy a VPS and the payment goes through it will take anywhere from 24-76 hours for you to recieve the VPS information.[/center]

[center]Connecting to your VPS.[/center]
[center]First you must wait for an email with VPS information from wherever you bought the vps, it should look something like this:

Next go to Start > Run > MSTSC.
It will load something that looks like this:

Enter in the IP address they sent you in the “computer” space, then in the “user name” enter administrator.
Then it will load up a program and you should see this:

Type in your Root Password you set up during buying the VPS.[/center]

[center]Running your server on your VPS[/center]
[center]Now you are on your VPS, next you need to download JDK before you can even run your server. So to download it go to: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html
Next you need to set your environment variables:
We will go to “My Computer” and click “View System Information”. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says “Advanced” and at the bottom, click “Environmental Variables”.
For you Classpath variable replace it with this:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Next find your Path variable and replace with this:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin;

If you are not running a 64-Bit System delete the (x86) from the Classpath and Path variables.
If a new version of JDK is released just edit the variables to fit yours, you also do not have to port-forward on a VPS.
[/center]

[center]Getting your server files.[/center]
[center]You will need to be able to get your server files over to your VPS, most of you should be able to figure this out on your own but for those who can’t I will tell you how. Use a file sharing site, there are many out there that are free but I will put a list of ones I most commonly use:
http://www.mediafire.com/
http://www.megaupload.com/
http://uppit.com/
http://www.fileden.com/
You will also need to download Winrar to extract them which can be found here:
http://www.rarlab.com/[/center]

[center]Last few things.[/center]
[center]If you try to run a Auto-Restarter or .exe on your VPS you might possibly get this error:

Don’t worry, it is easy to fix. First go to this site:Click Me!
Then you will see this:

Download it, it is “Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5” and it will allow you to run .exe files.[/center]

[center]Credits[/center]
[center]12igon8:For the tutorial he made which originally helped me months ago and made me want to improve upon it.
The Soul:For his tutorial on starting a server which helped me a while ago and also came in handy for Environment Variables.

RS2 Server Tutorial Rules and Regulations

You may post a tutorial that has already been created if and only if it surpasses any existing tutorials of its type.

Read full topic
